title: Diego Chaves (boxer)
text:
Diego Gabriel Chaves (born 7 April 1986) is an Argentine <a href="professional%20boxer">professional boxer</a> who held the <a href="World%20Boxing%20Association">WBA</a> <a href="interim%20championship">interim</a> <a href="welterweight">welterweight</a> title from 2012 to 2013.
Early life.
Diego Chaves was born on 7 April 1986, in <a href="San%20Miguel%2C%20Buenos%20Aires">San Miguel</a>, <a href="Argentina">Argentina</a>. Chaves had a stint as a <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player in the junior divisions of Argentine club <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20V%C3%A9lez%20S%C3%A1rsfield">Velez Sársfield</a> before dedicating his life to boxing. His grandfather, Rudecindo, was also a boxer who fought at <a href="middleweight">middleweight</a> in Argentina in the 1970s.
Before turning pro, Chaves represented Argentina in the <a href="Boxing%20at%20the%202007%20Pan%20American%20Games">2007 Pan American Games</a> where he won the bronze medal in the <a href="welterweight">welterweight</a> category. He also participated in the Americas qualifying tournament for the <a href="2008%20Summer%20Olympics">2008 Summer Olympics</a> but was eliminated.
Professional career.
Chaves made his debut at the age of 22 on 5 July 2008, against fellow countryman Juan José Islas in the town of <a href="Castelli%2C%20Buenos%20Aires">Castelli</a>, <a href="Buenos%20Aires">Buenos Aires</a>. Chaves won by knockout in the third round. After a string of victories on home soil, Chaves fought obtained the <a href="World%20Boxing%20Organization">WBO Latino</a> <a href="light%20middleweight">light middleweight</a> after defeating <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a>ian fighter Uilian Santana Barauna. Chaves made only one defense of this title before winning the vacant WBO Latino <a href="welterweight">welterweight</a> title against another boxer from Brazil, Daniel Saboia.
Around that time, Chaves had his first fight outside Argentina, winning a non-title fight by unanimous decision against Brazilian Edvan Dos Santos Barros at the <a href="Hard%20Rock%20Hotel%20and%20Casino%20%28Las%20Vegas%29">Hard Rock Hotel and Casino</a> in <a href="Paradise%2C%20Nevada">Paradise</a>, <a href="Nevada">Nevada</a>, <a href="United%20States">United States</a>. Chaves then returned to Argentina, where he made five successful defenses of his WBO Latino welterweight belt before defeating <a href="France">French</a> boxer <a href="Ismael%20El%20Massoudi">Ismael El Massoudi</a> to become <a href="World%20Boxing%20Association">WBA</a> Interim <a href="List%20of%20welterweight%20boxing%20champions">Welterweight Champion</a> on 21 July 2012. Since then, Chaves has successfully defended his Interim title once on 22 September 2012, defeating <a href="Panama">Panama</a>nian boxer José Miranda by <a href="technical%20knockout">technical knockout</a> in the second of twelve rounds.
